briefdescription.para: The integer number type.
The rational number type.
The polynomial type.
The algebraic number type.
obtains the numerator of a rational number.

simplesect.para: The numerator of q.

briefdescription.para: obtains the denominator of a rational number.

simplesect.para: The denominator of q.

briefdescription.para: converts an integer to an algebraic number.

simplesect.para: The algebraic number equivalent to z.

briefdescription.para: converts a rational number to an algebraic number.

simplesect.para: The algebraic number equivalent to q.

briefdescription.para: constructs a rational number that lies strictly between two algebraic values.

simplesect.para: The two values are not equal.
The rational number that lies in the open interval (x1, x2).

briefdescription.para: obtains a range of double-precision floats that contains the given algebraic number.

simplesect.para: The range of double-precision floats that contain x.

memberdef.argsstring: (InputIterator begin, InputIterator end, OutputIterator oi) const
memberdef.name: convert_coefficients

briefdescription.para: converts a sequence of rational coefficients to an equivalent sequence of integer coefficients.

detaileddescription.para: If the input coefficients are $q(1),\ldots,q(k)$, where $q(i) = n(i)/d(i)$, then the output coefficients will be of the form: $a(i) = \frac{n(i) \cdot \mathrm{lcm}(d(1),\ldots,d(k))}{d(i) \cdot \mathrm{gcd}(n(1),\ldots, n(k))}$. It inserts the output sequence into an output container given through an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: The begin iterator of the rational coefficients input container.
The past-the-end iterator of the rational coefficients input container.
The output iterator of the integer coefficients output container.

simplesect.para: The past-the-end iterator of the output container.
The value type of InputIterator is Rational.
Dereferencing oi must yield an object convertible to Integer.

briefdescription.para: computes the square root of an algebraic number.

simplesect.para: The square root of x.
x is non-negative.

memberdef.argsstring: (const NT &a, const NT &b, const NT &c, OutputIterator oi) const
memberdef.name: solve_quadratic_equation

briefdescription.para: computes the roots of a quadratic equations $a*x^2+ b*x + c = 0$ with integer coefficients, and inserts them into an output container given through an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: The output iterator of the output container of real-valued solutions of the quadratic equation.

simplesect.para: The past-the-end iterator of the output container.
Dereferencing oi must yield an object convertible to Algebraic.

briefdescription.para: constructs a polynomial with integer coefficients.

parameterdescription.para: The coefficients of the input polynomial.
The degree of the input polynomial.

simplesect.para: The polynomial.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Rational *coeffs, unsigned int degree, Polynomial &poly, Integer &poly_denom) const
memberdef.name: construct_polynomial

briefdescription.para: constructs a polynomial with integer coefficients given rational coefficients.

parameterdescription.para: The coefficients of the input polynomial.
The degree of the input polynomial.
Output: The resulting polynomial with integer coefficients.
Output: The denominator for the polynomial.

simplesect.para: Whether this polynomial is non-zero (false if the polynomial is zero).

memberdef.argsstring: (const Rational *p_coeffs, unsigned int p_degree, const Rational *q_coeffs, unsigned int q_degree, Polynomial &p_poly, Polynomial &q_poly) const
memberdef.name: construct_polynomials

briefdescription.para: constructs two polynomials with integer coefficients such that $P(x)/Q(x)$ is a rational function equivalent to the one represented by the two given vectors of rational coefficients.

detaileddescription.para: It is guaranteed that the GCD of $P(x)$ and $Q(x)$ is trivial.

parameterdescription.para: The coefficients of the input numerator polynomial.
The degree of the input numerator polynomial.
The coefficients of the input denominator polynomial.
The degree of the input denominator polynomial.
Output: The resulting numerator polynomial with integer coefficients.
Output: The resulting denominator polynomial with integer coefficients.

simplesect.para: true on success; false if the denominator is 0.

briefdescription.para: Compute the degree of a polynomial.
evaluates a polynomial at a given $x$-value.

simplesect.para: The value of the polynomial at x.

briefdescription.para: computes the derivative of the given polynomial.

simplesect.para: The derivative $p'(x)$.

briefdescription.para: multiplies a polynomial by some scalar coefficient.

simplesect.para: The scalar multiplication $a \cdot P(x)$.

briefdescription.para: performs "long division" of two polynomials: Given $A(x)$ and $B(x)$ compute two polynomials $Q(x)$ and $R(x)$ such that: $A(x) = Q(x) \cdot B(x) + R(x)$ and $R(x)$ has minimal degree.

simplesect.para: The quontient polynomial $Q(x)$.

briefdescription.para: computes the real-valued roots of a polynomial with integer coefficients, and inserts them in ascending order into an output container given through an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: The output iterator of the output container of real-valued root of the polynomial.

simplesect.para: The past-the-end iterator of the output container.
Dereferencing oi must yield an object convertible to Algebraic.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Polynomial &poly, double x_min, double x_max, OutputIterator oi) const
memberdef.name: compute_polynomial_roots

briefdescription.para: computes the real-valued roots of a polynomial with integer coefficients within a given interval, and inserts them in ascending order into an output container given through an output iterator.

parameterdescription.para: The left bound of the interval.
The right bound of the interval.
The output iterator of the output container of the real-valued root of the polynomial.

simplesect.para: The past-the-end iterator of the output container.
Dereferencing oi must yield an object convertible to Algebraic.

briefdescription.para: CORE_algebraic_number_traits is a traits class for CORE's algebraic number types.
